node.title: React Lazy Load not working with variable path
node.bodyHTML:
I have the same issue when using Lazy Load with variable path.

if I put the path in the variable, I see "Can't find the module"

const filePath = `@pages/general/general`;
const component = React.lazy(() => import(`${filePath}`));

but if I put the path directly, it's working

  const component = React.lazy(() => import("@pages/general/general"));

any suggestions?

_Originally posted by #16132 (comment)

node.bodyText:
Dynamic import with a variable requires using bundlers (e.g. Webpack) that support this syntax.

node.title: Bug:  Unable to set `value` of ButtonHTMLAttributes to object type
node.bodyText:
React version: Type definitions for React 18.0
Steps To Reproduce

Attempt to set the value to button as anything that is not (string | ReadOnlyArray | number | undefined)

Link to code example:
Link to example in code sandbox
The current behavior
Error Message from TS
Type '{ name: string; sortOrder: number; }' is not assignable to type 'string | number | string[]'.
  Object literal may only specify known properties, and 'name' does not exist in type 'string[]'.ts(2322)
index.d.ts(1788, 9): The expected type comes from property 'value' which is declared here on type 'DetailedHTMLProps<ButtonHTMLAttributes<HTMLButtonElement>, HTMLButtonElement>'

The expected behavior
Don't give me an error for this, there are no type constraints on the value for a button.
This is causing an issue with library Material-ui (Mui.com) which uses the interface ButtonHTMLAttributes<T> extends HTMLAttributes<T> which says the value can only be of type string | ReadonlyArray<string> | number | undefined. They use it on their MenuItem component which is used within the Select component which disallows the use of assigning an object to the MenuItem. I can @ts-ignore this or set the object to as any and bypass the TS issue and the HTML works.
To me if you can use @ts-ignore or as any to get around a TS error there is an issue with the types applied to the attributes for the HMLT element.
Please let me know if this is correct to post here or should Mui.com be responsible to not type the MenuItem as an extension of this interface which ultimately is preventing me from assigning the object to the value.
node.bodyHTML:
React version: Type definitions for React 18.0

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Attempt to set the value to button as anything that is not (string | ReadOnlyArray | number | undefined)

Link to code example:

Link to example in code sandbox

The current behavior

Error Message from TS

Type '{ name: string; sortOrder: number; }' is not assignable to type 'string | number | string[]'.
  Object literal may only specify known properties, and 'name' does not exist in type 'string[]'.ts(2322)
index.d.ts(1788, 9): The expected type comes from property 'value' which is declared here on type 'DetailedHTMLProps<ButtonHTMLAttributes<HTMLButtonElement>, HTMLButtonElement>'

The expected behavior

Don't give me an error for this, there are no type constraints on the value for a button.

This is causing an issue with library Material-ui (Mui.com) which uses the interface ButtonHTMLAttributes<T> extends HTMLAttributes<T> which says the value can only be of type string | ReadonlyArray<string> | number | undefined. They use it on their MenuItem component which is used within the Select component which disallows the use of assigning an object to the MenuItem. I can @ts-ignore this or set the object to as any and bypass the TS issue and the HTML works.

To me if you can use @ts-ignore or as any to get around a TS error there is an issue with the types applied to the attributes for the HMLT element.

Please let me know if this is correct to post here or should Mui.com be responsible to not type the MenuItem as an extension of this interface which ultimately is preventing me from assigning the object to the value.

node.bodyText: The value is passed to the native <button /> HTML element and does not allow an object. It would end up as '[object Object]' in the rendered output and event handlers using event.currentTarget.value.
node.bodyHTML: The value is passed to the native <button /> HTML element and does not allow an object. It would end up as '[object Object]' in the rendered output and event handlers using event.currentTarget.value.

node.bodyText: I see then it is an issue with mui.com types trying to use buttons types because thiers works and using a straight button doesn't allow an object.
node.bodyHTML: I see then it is an issue with mui.com types trying to use buttons types because thiers works and using a straight button doesn't allow an object.

node.title: Bug: Unexpected useState behavior on StrictMode
node.bodyText:
Not sure if this is a bug, but when using StrictMode whether it is for production/development build, the callback in a setState setState(callback) is correctly called once. But the next call to setState will trigger the callback twice using the example described below.
React version: 18.2.0
Steps To Reproduce

Open https://codesandbox.io/s/recursing-firefly-gwcp3m?file=/src/App.js
Click "Add" counter will increment to 2
Click "Add" again, counter will increment to 5 (should be 3)


Link to code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/recursing-firefly-gwcp3m?file=/src/App.js

The current behavior
setState callback is called twice on the 2nd++ setState call
The expected behavior
setState callback is called once on the 2nd++ setState call
node.bodyHTML:
Not sure if this is a bug, but when using StrictMode whether it is for production/development build, the callback in a setState setState(callback) is correctly called once. But the next call to setState will trigger the callback twice using the example described below.

React version: 18.2.0

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Open https://codesandbox.io/s/recursing-firefly-gwcp3m?file=/src/App.js
  2. Click "Add" counter will increment to 2
  3. Click "Add" again, counter will increment to 5 (should be 3)

Link to code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/recursing-firefly-gwcp3m?file=/src/App.js

The current behavior

setState callback is called twice on the 2nd++ setState call

The expected behavior

setState callback is called once on the 2nd++ setState call

node.bodyText: Dupe: #12856 (comment)
node.bodyHTML: Dupe: #12856 (comment)

It may or may not be a bug, but I wouldn't write the code as you did, I would do that as follows:

import { useState } from "react";
import "./styles.css";

export default function App() {
  const [data, setData] = useState({ counter: 0 });
  return (
    <div className="App">
      <div>Counter: {data.counter}</div>
      <button onClick={() => setData(prev => ({...prev, counter: prev.counter++}))}>
        Add
      </button>
    </div>
  );
}

node.bodyText: @danieltkach obv https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-param-reassign
node.bodyHTML: @danieltkach obv https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-param-reassign

node.title: Bug: setState2 still uses old value of setState1 even though state1's value is already updated
node.bodyHTML:
I have a couple of inputs and I want to call setInputData state synchronously right after I set setInputValues state, because it makes use of its updated value, however no matter what I try it always gets the delayed value of what it was in the previous keystroke entered to the inputs.

Even when using setTimeout, when setting the setInputData , it has a previous version of the inputValues that was set before it, no matter how much delay I give it. Even when even when both of them are deep clone or both shallow clone still same occurrence. I don't understand how even after waiting with setTimeout for the setInputValues state to finish updating, my setInputData state is still not getting the real-time value of inputValues, even when the real-time value is shown inside the <pre> tag

I simply want to set state2 after setting state1 because state2 makes use of state1's updated value.
However I don't think useEffect subcription is an apt solution because I need the passed argument of the inputName to be used when setting both states.

React version: 18.0.0

Steps To Reproduce

This is the entire app

import { useState } from 'react'

export default function App() {
	const [initialValues] = useState({ email: 'initialval', city: '' })
	const [inputValues, setInputValues] = useState(initialValues)
	const [inputData, setInputData] = useState({ email: { isDirty: false }, city: { isDirty: false } })

	function inputChange(e, inputName) {
		setInputValues((prev) => {
			let clone = { ...prev }
			clone[inputName] = e.target.value
			console.warn(`setting inputValues[${inputName}] to: ${e.target.value}`)
			return clone
		})
		setTimeout(() => {
			setInputData((prev) => {
				console.log('current inputValue: ' + inputValues[inputName])
				let clone = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(prev))
				clone[inputName].isDirty = inputValues[inputName] === initialValues[inputName] ? false : true
				return clone
			})
		}, 500)
	}

	return (
		<>
			<input onChange={(e) => inputChange(e, 'email')} value={inputValues.email} />
			<input onChange={(e) => inputChange(e, 'city')} value={inputValues.city} />
			inputValues<pre>{JSON.stringify(inputValues, null, 4)}</pre>
			inputData<pre>{JSON.stringify(inputData, null, 4)}</pre>
		</>
	)
}

Link to code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/react-bug-wtf-guzldd?file=/src/App.js

The current behavior

As you can see in the screenshot, the value of inputValues is always behind 1 keystroke.

The expected behavior

I expect by the time I am setting setInputData it will have access to the latest inputValues that was set before it.
I have heard that sometimes React batches together state updates, but this still doesn't make sense because there is even a setTimeout put in place, and usually setting states one after another has worked perfectly fine for me, and most importantly, the state is already updated everywhere else as shown in the <pre> tag, and by the time setInputData is called the updated value of inputValues is shown in the pre tag yet it still uses the old value.
If the current behavior is the expected behavior, I would appreciate greatly if someone shows me a way to accomplish what I am trying to do

node.bodyText:
Does this help?
https://beta.reactjs.org/learn/state-as-a-snapshot
You shouldn't need to do anything special since you already have e.target.value and so you know what you're setting the state to.
node.bodyHTML:
Does this help?

https://beta.reactjs.org/learn/state-as-a-snapshot

You shouldn't need to do anything special since you already have e.target.value and so you know what you're setting the state to.

node.title: Select component in inspect element to be opened in IDE
node.bodyText:
We plan to create a method for accessing the specific file of a web component in a browsers inspect element, such that it opens on an IDE. This would allow developers a more continuous workflow between development and testing of web components.
We recognize that the React Dev Tools browser extension accomplishes a similar task, but remains within the browser rather than directing the user to a chosen IDE.
node.bodyHTML:
We plan to create a method for accessing the specific file of a web component in a browsers inspect element, such that it opens on an IDE. This would allow developers a more continuous workflow between development and testing of web components.

We recognize that the React Dev Tools browser extension accomplishes a similar task, but remains within the browser rather than directing the user to a chosen IDE.

node.bodyText: If you go the React devtools Components tab > Settings > Components > Editor URL you can enable this behavior already:
node.bodyHTML: If you go the React devtools Components tab > Settings > Components > Editor URL you can enable this behavior already:

node.title: Sending formData to two different urls
node.bodyText: hello everyone, I have a problem when sending input values ​​to the backend. I have 4 input fields (name, email, message and file), the first three are sent to one url and the files from the same form go to another url. How can I send through the same form with the axios.post method complete data from the form immediately on the submit button? I would use formData for that action

node.title: Bug:
node.bodyHTML:
So in a large class component. I'm trying to render a third party component
from import Autocomplete from 'react-google-autocomplete'

  • This leverages a Hook, therefore I am unable to render it because the class using it is a CLASS (no hooks allowed in classes). I can not modify this third party Autocomplete component. I linked the exact bug and code.

Code provided to understand

  • BUG: the actual issue,
  • CODE: where the functional component is put in the class,
  • IMPORTS: my imports in the class component,
  • SOMECOMPONENT: the actual functional component

BUG

Uncaught Error: Invalid hook call. Hooks can only be called inside of the body of a function component. This could happen for one of the following reasons:

  1. You might have mismatching versions of React and the renderer (such as React DOM)
  2. You might be breaking the Rules of Hooks
  3. You might have more than one copy of React in the same app

CODE

<GoogleMap google={this.props.google}
defaultZoom={this.props.zoom}
defaultCenter={{ lat: this.state.mapPosition.lat, lng: this.state.mapPosition.lng }}
>
<InfoWindow
onClose={this.onInfoWindowClose}
position={{ lat: (this.state.markerPosition.lat + 0.0018), lng: this.state.markerPosition.lng }}
>


<span style={{ padding: 0, margin: 0 }}>{this.state.address}


<Marker google={this.props.google}
name={'Dolores park'}
draggable={true}
onDragEnd={this.onMarkerDragEnd}
position={{ lat: this.state.markerPosition.lat, lng: this.state.markerPosition.lng }}
/>


IMPORTS

import React from 'react'
import { withGoogleMap, GoogleMap, withScriptjs, InfoWindow, Marker } from "react-google-maps";
import Autocomplete from 'react-google-autocomplete';
// import Autocomplete from './MyAutocomplete';
import SomeComponent from './SomeComponent'
import Geocode from "react-geocode";

SOMECOMPONENT

import { useState } from 'react';

function SomeComponent() {
// Declare a new state variable, which we'll call "count"
const [count, setCount] = useState(0);

return (


You clicked {count} times


{count}
<button onClick={() => setCount(count + 1)}>
Click me


);
}

export default SomeComponent

node.title: Bug: Error when trying to use @intel/react-pixi package. Expected subtree parent to be a mounted class component. This error is likely caused by a bug in React.
node.bodyText:
React version: 18.2.0 Steps To Reproduce Yarn create vite Yarn install pixi.js @inlet/react-pixi Try this example: import { Stage, Sprite } from "@inlet/react-pixi"; export default function App() { return (
); } Link to code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/festive-pike-j8f2pu?file=/src/App.tsx The current behavior Error Expected subtree parent to be a mounted class component. This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue. The expected behavior A canvas with a sprite in the middle (https://codepen.io/dinopens/pen/QWrrmgx):
node.bodyHTML:
React version: 18.2.0

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Yarn create vite
  2. Yarn install pixi.js @inlet/react-pixi
  3. Try this example:
import { Stage, Sprite } from "@inlet/react-pixi";

export default function App() {
  return (
    <div>
      <Stage width={200} height={200}>
        <Sprite x={100} y={100} image="https://s3-us-west-2.amazonaws.com/s.cdpn.io/693612/IaUrttj.png"/>
      </Stage>
    </div>
  );
}

Link to code example: https://codesandbox.io/s/festive-pike-j8f2pu?file=/src/App.tsx

The current behavior

Error
Expected subtree parent to be a mounted class component. This error is likely caused by a bug in React. Please file an issue.

The expected behavior

A canvas with a sprite in the middle (https://codepen.io/dinopens/pen/QWrrmgx):

node.bodyText:
I would suggest filing this against @inlet/react-pixi instead so that they can reduce this to a minimal repro.
Right now this error seems expected since @inlet/react-pixi has no official support for React 18: It only support ^17.0.1 according to their peerDependencies.
Once they have a minimal repro, that's not using 3rd party dependencies and produces the same error, we can revisit.
node.bodyHTML:
I would suggest filing this against @inlet/react-pixi instead so that they can reduce this to a minimal repro.
Right now this error seems expected since @inlet/react-pixi has no official support for React 18: It only support ^17.0.1 according to their peerDependencies.

Once they have a minimal repro, that's not using 3rd party dependencies and produces the same error, we can revisit.

node.title: setState haven't effect inside function applied to ref
node.bodyHTML:
React version: react: 18.2.0

Steps To Reproduce

export function useCurrent<T extends Record<string,Function>>(fns:T):T{
  let ref = useRef(fns)
  for(let key in fns){
    ref.current[key] = fns[key]
  }
  return ref.current
}
  1. useCurrent inside a function component
  2. call it inside an Effect

I simulated the simplest demo, but this problem cannot be reproduced, please see my picture below after demo.
Link to code example: https://codepen.io/diqye/pen/BaxPadW

The current behavior

The expected behavior

setState is always effect

@YuvarajPandiyan: We're sorry you've seen this error. ❤️
It looks like you forgot to specify a valid URL. (This means that we will not be able to reproduce the problem you're reporting.)
Please help us by providing a link to a CodeSandbox (https://codesandbox.io/s/new), a repository on GitHub, or a minimal code example that reproduces the problem. (Screenshots or videos can also be helpful if they help provide context on how to repro the bug.)
Here are some tips for providing a minimal example: https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve
Issues without repros are automatically closed but we will re-open if you update with repro info.

node.title: Bug: React.memo and generics won't work
node.bodyText:
When using React.memo and generics in Typescript, there is an issue with props, at-least for me, when providing a function in props.
React version: 18.2.0
Steps To Reproduce

Typescript will complain for props types immediately when compiling Typescript

Link to code example:
https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/JYWwDg9gTgLgBAJQKYEMDG8BmUIjgcilQ3wG4Aoc4AOxiSk3STgEkB5MGYCagHgBUAfHADe5OBLhEUAEx4AbAJ5wAbinkBXJAC44-CpKmo51JXHkoARknm6AzjCg0A5hQC+lGnQZNWABRwwOwFhMUNpEzMuGHkdOAcnaldxSQiFZQhObmo7XXYsnhCAbQBdA1TjdPibJAwkGQ4uHl19FIk00wzqAGUajEbs3QAKNU04--ICvATi805COCMzitCvC9tW-b1o2dAyIqZLGkSNykkuSApti252BqHrMoGdhkYYZ73jhe5UURjG1Mxgb0ZIPC9ExLGESSvE+nubhwJSlJwGwyooIo0KUpig5AA
The current behavior
Typescript complain about function in props
The expected behavior
Should not complain
Manual fix
Can be fixed if doing:
declare module "react" { // augment React types
    function memo<A, B>(Component: (props: A) => B): (props: A) => React.ReactElement | null
    // return type is same as ReturnType<ExoticComponent<any>>
}
node.bodyHTML:
When using React.memo and generics in Typescript, there is an issue with props, at-least for me, when providing a function in props.

React version: 18.2.0

Steps To Reproduce

  1. Typescript will complain for props types immediately when compiling Typescript

Link to code example:
https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/JYWwDg9gTgLgBAJQKYEMDG8BmUIjgcilQ3wG4Aoc4AOxiSk3STgEkB5MGYCagHgBUAfHADe5OBLhEUAEx4AbAJ5wAbinkBXJAC44-CpKmo51JXHkoARknm6AzjCg0A5hQC+lGnQZNWABRwwOwFhMUNpEzMuGHkdOAcnaldxSQiFZQhObmo7XXYsnhCAbQBdA1TjdPibJAwkGQ4uHl19FIk00wzqAGUajEbs3QAKNU04--ICvATi805COCMzitCvC9tW-b1o2dAyIqZLGkSNykkuSApti252BqHrMoGdhkYYZ73jhe5UURjG1Mxgb0ZIPC9ExLGESSvE+nubhwJSlJwGwyooIo0KUpig5AA

The current behavior

Typescript complain about function in props

The expected behavior

Should not complain

Manual fix

Can be fixed if doing:

declare module "react" { // augment React types
    function memo<A, B>(Component: (props: A) => B): (props: A) => React.ReactElement | null
    // return type is same as ReturnType<ExoticComponent<any>>
}

node.bodyText: Please file typing issues in https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped where they are maintained.
node.bodyHTML: Please file typing issues in https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped where they are maintained.

node.title: Bug: Issue with absolute imports in react application with bootsraped project
node.bodyText:
React version: 18.2.0
There is an issue with the way absolute imports are handled in project bootstraped with create-react-app version 5.0.1
I configured correctly the absolute imports according to the CRA docs. Some of the absolute imports works, some of them don't
I have created a reproducible demo of the issue available on this link
Steps To Reproduce
Clone the repository of this link and please follow the next steps :

Run yarn install
Run yarn start

You will see the following error in your browser Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@/utils'
I have written a small documentation on the README.md of the reproducible issue repo to add some important details

Link to code example:
https://github.com/Vikmanatus/reactjs-absolute-imports-issue

The current behavior
An error is thrown saying that @/utils cannot be resolved
The expected behavior
The import of the makeId function of this repo should work with the following absolute import:
import { makeid } from "@/utils";       // Throws an error
The strange thing is that the compiler throws an error when it imports the function but accepts the absolute import of a type 🤔
import { FakeObjectType } from "@/types";   // No error
node.bodyHTML:
React version: 18.2.0

There is an issue with the way absolute imports are handled in project bootstraped with create-react-app version 5.0.1
I configured correctly the absolute imports according to the CRA docs. Some of the absolute imports works, some of them don't
I have created a reproducible demo of the issue available on this link

Steps To Reproduce

Clone the repository of this link and please follow the next steps :

  1. Run yarn install
  2. Run yarn start

You will see the following error in your browser Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@/utils'

I have written a small documentation on the README.md of the reproducible issue repo to add some important details

Link to code example:

https://github.com/Vikmanatus/reactjs-absolute-imports-issue

The current behavior

An error is thrown saying that @/utils cannot be resolved

The expected behavior

The import of the makeId function of this repo should work with the following absolute import:

import { makeid } from "@/utils";       // Throws an error

The strange thing is that the compiler throws an error when it imports the function but accepts the absolute import of a type 🤔

import { FakeObjectType } from "@/types";   // No error

node.title: Bug: Issue with absolute imports in react application
node.bodyText:
React version: 18.2.0
There seems to be an issue with the way that absolute imports are being handled in react 18. Even with a properly configured tsconfig.json, some of the absolute imports works but some of them don't (see section The expected behavior).
For example, I am able to do an absolute import on a type, but the demo crashes when I try to import a function the same way
I have opened this issue because I cannot figure out if the issue is coming from create-react-app or the react official repository.
I have created a reproducible demo available on this link
Steps To Reproduce
Clone the repository of this link and please follow the next steps :

Run yarn install
Run yarn start

You will see the following error in your browser Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@/utils'
I have written a small documentation on the README.md of the reproducible issue repo to add some important details

Link to code example:
https://github.com/Vikmanatus/reactjs-absolute-imports-issue

The current behavior
An error is thrown saying that @/utils cannot be resolved
Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@/utils' in '/Users/someUser/Desktop/SomeFolder/reactjs-absolute-imports-issue/src'
The expected behavior
The import of the makeId function of this repo should work with the following absolute import:
import { makeid } from "@/utils";       // Throws an error
The strange thing is that the compiler throws an error when it imports the function but accepts the absolute import of a type 🤔
import { FakeObjectType } from "@/types";   // No error
node.bodyHTML:
React version: 18.2.0

There seems to be an issue with the way that absolute imports are being handled in react 18. Even with a properly configured tsconfig.json, some of the absolute imports works but some of them don't (see section The expected behavior).
For example, I am able to do an absolute import on a type, but the demo crashes when I try to import a function the same way

I have opened this issue because I cannot figure out if the issue is coming from create-react-app or the react official repository.

I have created a reproducible demo available on this link

Steps To Reproduce

Clone the repository of this link and please follow the next steps :

  1. Run yarn install
  2. Run yarn start

You will see the following error in your browser Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@/utils'

I have written a small documentation on the README.md of the reproducible issue repo to add some important details

Link to code example:

https://github.com/Vikmanatus/reactjs-absolute-imports-issue

The current behavior

An error is thrown saying that @/utils cannot be resolved

Module not found: Error: Can't resolve '@/utils' in '/Users/someUser/Desktop/SomeFolder/reactjs-absolute-imports-issue/src'

The expected behavior

The import of the makeId function of this repo should work with the following absolute import:

import { makeid } from "@/utils";       // Throws an error

The strange thing is that the compiler throws an error when it imports the function but accepts the absolute import of a type 🤔

import { FakeObjectType } from "@/types";   // No error

node.bodyText:
Hello @eps1lon
Thank you very much for your quick reply
I think there is misunderstanding, the issue reported is not a support request, it is indeed an issue
I have found a list of similar issues and tried all the solution suggested and we seem to have mostly all the same issue

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/68416916/create-react-app-absolute-imports-dont-work-with-yarn-v2-workspaces-typescrip
facebook/create-react-app#11976
https://sta ckoverflow.com/questions/72132090/absolute-imports-issue-in-react-with-typescript
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72017719/absolute-imports-arent-working-in-reactjs
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73370209/absolute-path-not-working-for-create-react-app-with-typescript

React-Typescript support's the absolute imports by default, I have the same import system implemented in many React.js projects built on React v.17 who are still working very well
But it really seem's that since React v.18 release there is this issue going on, I am able to reproduce it with every new react project created with React v.18
Are you able to reproduce the issue with the reproducible demo given ?
node.bodyHTML:
Hello @eps1lon

Thank you very much for your quick reply

I think there is misunderstanding, the issue reported is not a support request, it is indeed an issue

I have found a list of similar issues and tried all the solution suggested and we seem to have mostly all the same issue

  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/68416916/create-react-app-absolute-imports-dont-work-with-yarn-v2-workspaces-typescrip
  • facebook/create-react-app#11976
  • https://sta ckoverflow.com/questions/72132090/absolute-imports-issue-in-react-with-typescript
  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/72017719/absolute-imports-arent-working-in-reactjs
  • https://stackoverflow.com/questions/73370209/absolute-path-not-working-for-create-react-app-with-typescript

React-Typescript support's the absolute imports by default, I have the same import system implemented in many React.js projects built on React v.17 who are still working very well

But it really seem's that since React v.18 release there is this issue going on, I am able to reproduce it with every new react project created with React v.18

Are you able to reproduce the issue with the reproducible demo given ?

node.bodyText: It's highly unlikely that something related to resolving imports is caused by react. It's very likely handled by the framework you're using when bundling the application. If you're using Create React App, you should file the issue against facebook/create-react-app instead. I still believe this is a configuration issue that should be solved via support channels and not an issue with the framework since Create React App does have support for absolute paths.
node.bodyHTML: It's highly unlikely that something related to resolving imports is caused by react. It's very likely handled by the framework you're using when bundling the application. If you're using Create React App, you should file the issue against facebook/create-react-app instead. I still believe this is a configuration issue that should be solved via support channels and not an issue with the framework since Create React App does have support for absolute paths.

node.bodyText: I would also recommend reading through https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example to ensure support requests can be answered as best as possible (e.g. you're not including the error message in your description).
node.bodyHTML: I would also recommend reading through https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example to ensure support requests can be answered as best as possible (e.g. you're not including the error message in your description).

node.bodyText:
Thank you very much for your response @eps1lon
My bad, I apologize, I did forgot to paste the output of the error, I have updated the section
I wish this was a configuration issue, but the problem is that some absolute imports works on new projects generated with CRA (e.g.: I am able to import a type with an absolute import) but some of them don't (e.g.: the import of a function breaks the application). Also I have been able to reproduce it on three new CRA project with the typescript template 🙁
I wasn't sure on which side I was supposed to create the thread, thank you very much for your answer
I have already opened a stack overflow thread on this subject, I'll open an issue on create-react-app repository
Thank you very much for your help and have a great day 🙂
Best regards
